roleset.name: become twofold
roleset.note: DOUBLE-V NOTES: Note the ADV tagging of modifiers such as "almost" or "more than". (from double.01-v)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: One person familiar with Georgia-Pacific said the acquisition would more than double the company's debt of almost $3 billion.
example.arg: the company's debt of almost $3 billion

example.name: with end point
example.text: That purchase doubled Quebecor's annual printing revenue to $750 million.

example.name: start and end points, ergative
example.text: Genentech Inc. said third-quarter profit more than doubled to $11.4 million, or 13 cents a share, from a depressed 1988 third-quarter performance of $5.3 million, or six cents a share.
example.arg: to $11.4 million, or 13 cents a share,
from a depressed 1988 third-quarter performance of $5.3 million, or six cents a share

roleset.name: act
roleset.note: DOUBLE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'double' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Comparison to 'rise'. (from double.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: double agent
example.text: One expert, whose job is so politically sensitive that he spoke on condition that he wouldn't be named, said the expected influx of East European refugees over the next few years will greatly increase the number of computer-maintenance workers, for example, doubling as foreign spies.

example.name: double-j
example.text: Joan Darrah , a retired Navy Captain , echoed Alva â€™s sentiments , saying that she was constantly forced to live a double life while serving .

example.name: double-j
example.text: New research from MIT shows that the Earth's geomagnetic field intensity is double the long-term historical average
